title: By the Book
name: By the Book
description:
A Map by Mollyjorose

Herein lies a map to some of the best bookstores I have been privileged to rummage through.

properties.name: Firehouse Books
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose405 Kellogg Ave, Ames, IAOnce upon a time, this was a very nice place to shop. Locally owned with children darting behind shelves who belonged to the bookstore owner much like the books on the shelves. Alas, alack. A new owner overtook it and stole a little bit of the sheen from small town Iowa life.

properties.name: Friends of the Library Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose315 S Rose St, Kalamazoo, MIThere is another used bookstore in Kalamazoo called Kazoo books, but for unbelievable price and frequently turned over selection, the Friends of the Library Bookstore cannot be beat. On any given day, well, as long as it\'s Wednesday through Saturday, you can walk out of that place with five or six great books all for the low, low price of fifty cents each. On top of that fifty cents, students get a 10% discount. Holy crap, that\'s good book selling.

properties.name: Half Price Books Records Magazines
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose20125 Van Aken Blvd, Shaker Heights, OHThere is nothing in particular about this Half Price Books that makes it any better than all the other Half Price Books out there. It\'s a damn fine used bookstore establishment. I\'m proud to be a frequent customer.

properties.name: Mono Lake Chamber of Commerce
properties.description: Posted by MollyjoroseI know what you\'re thinking, but trust me. This is a helluva bookstore. You want Abbey? Of course they\'ve got him. Lopez? Muir? McPhee? Tempest-Williams? Shit, yeah.

properties.name: Prairie Lights Books
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose15 South Dubuque Street, Iowa City, IA, 52240Prairie Lights is good because of the Writer\'s Workshop at the University of Iowa, or perhaps this is a chicken and egg thing. Either way, take a gander at their 2007 Readings List: http://www.prairielightsbooks.com/NASApp/store/IndexJsp?s=storeevents

properties.name: Recycled Books Records CD's
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose200 N Locust St, Denton, TXI must admit, I have never been here, but my boyfriend will not stop talking about it. When asked what the best thing was that he ever found here, he said, "Everything."

properties.name: Red Fox Inn
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose 05081 Boyne City-Charlevoix Road, Horton Bay, MichiganThis is true Hemingway country. The proprietor, James Hartwell, will sell you your choice of annotated or unannotated versions of the Nick Adams stories. Grab a brew at the Horton Bay General Store, pick up a copy of a book with notes, and head down to Walloon Lake.

properties.name: Shaman Drum Bookshop
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose313 S Division St, Ann Arbor, MIIndependent and nutritious, just like ... I don\'t know what, but it\'s nice inside. No used books, however, which is sort of a letdown.

properties.name: Square Books
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose160 Courthouse Square, Oxford, MSYou can\'t beat these shops (there are several in this quaintest of quaint Southern communities) for great Southern literature. Why would you buy Faulkner anywhere else than here, which is within a mile of both the Compson House and Rowan Oak?

properties.name: Sundance Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose 1155 W 4th St Ste 106, Reno, NVReno has very little going for it. It\'s like Vegas, but without the soul, whimsy, and depleted sense of hope that keeps the shine on Vegas. Reno is, in a word, desperate. In two words, it is like hell, save for the existence of Sundance Bookstore very near the Truckee River. Without it, I might have become Reno-fied and might still be turning tricks somewhere by the bus station.

properties.name: Tattered Cover Book Store
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose2955 East 1st Avenue, Denver, CO, 80206Several levels of erudite choices in a lovely setting. Ah, Denver.

properties.name: Trident Booksellers Incorporated
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose940 Pearl St, Boulder, COSome places have books outside to peruse and enjoy. This is one of them. Also, there is a cafe inside with unbelievable good and chewy Ginger cookies.

properties.name: Unabridged Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Mollyjorose3251 N Broadway, chicagoOne of David Sedaris\' favorite bookstores. Need I say more. (And thank you, Diana, for introducing me to this place).
